CatDescriptText: Miss Joyce Dicicco, gift shop manager, 509 Russellwood Street, McKees Rocks, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that American citizens should receive Russia's first deputy premier, Anastas I. Mikoyan hospitably, or deport themselves in unhospitable fashion like some have done in several cities where Mikoyan has visited?" answer reads: �I don�t think that he should be treated as a guest. He shouldn�t be welcomed with open arms because of the way our people have been treated by the Russians.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joyce Dicicco, wearing earrings, light colored turtleneck,  dark coat, and wristwatch, holding rolled papers in right pocket, standing with hands in pockets on sidewalk with people, buildings, and truck
